page.title: 13St. Mary's Church, Watton
page.content: The parish church of Watton stands within the precincts of the ruined Priory. Built of brick, the church dates from the 14th Century, perhaps early Tudor, but contains evidence of late 15th Century and late 16th / early 17th Century additions and alterations. The church consists of Chancel, Nave, South Porch and low Western Tower. The Nave holds seating for around 150 worshippers. Its roof is an open gable supported lattice of moulded, coloured beams, decorated with bosses of carved faces and shields. The font (perhaps Early English) is said to have been found in a nearby field. Some old bells are displayed at the west end of the Nave. These were replaced in 1891 by the present peal of 8 Harringtons patent tubular bells.
